Instruction: Combine diced potatoes and thinly sliced onions in a microwave-safe dish. Sprinkle the mixture with garlic powder and water, cover the bowl, and microwave on high until the potatoes are tender, about 8 to 10 minutes.

Combine butter and flour in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly until the butter is melted. Gradually add milk and continue stirring until the mixture reaches a gravy-like consistency. Lower the heat, mix in the Dijon-mayonnaise blend, and ensure it is well combined. Remove from heat and cover the saucepan.

Combine the cooked potatoes with the prepared gravy mixture; stir well to coat the potatoes. Cover the bowl and microwave on medium heat to allow the flavors to meld, for about 3 to 5 minutes. Let the dish stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Use margarine instead of butter if preferred.
